title: Wits common wealth The second part. A treasurie of diuine, morall, and phylosophicall similies, and sentences, generally vsefull. But more particularly published, for the vse of schooles. By F.M. Master of Arts of bot Vniuersities.
author: Meres, Francis, 1565-1647.
publisher: Printed by William Stansby, and are to be sold by Richard Royston, at his shop in Iuie Lane,
notes: Number 2 in the "Wits" series, presented as a sequel to "Politeuphuia wits common wealth" by Nicholas Ling.
Reproduction of the original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
